title: Identify the Atoms and Their Counts
text: Start by breaking down the formula CH₃CH₂OH into its parts. Count how many carbons, hydrogens, and oxygens you should have in the structure.

title: Recognize the Carbon Backbone
text: Ethanol has two carbons bonded together in a chain. One carbon is bonded to three hydrogens, and the other is bonded to two hydrogens and to the oxygen.

title: Look at the Oxygen Atom
text: Oxygen should have two lone pairs and form two bonds: one to carbon and one to hydrogen.

title: Check for Correct Bonding
text: Make sure all carbons have four bonds, oxygen has two bonds and two lone pairs, and hydrogens have only one bond each.
